gw.api.exception

Class MessageFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.exception.MessageFragment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ErrorDetail

    public class MessageFragment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the information needed to create a message, or to explicitly set the message string. This is the base for an ErrorDetail, which is also the base for the ErrorInfo. So all three of these objects treat a message the same way. This class uses a builder pattern to simplify construction of the exception: errorInfo.withDevMessage(new MessageFragment().withMessage("A message");

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageFragment

        public MessageFragment()
        This constructor will create a message fragment for those messages that don't have a display key. You should call the withMessage method to set the text. You can still add properties with the "with" method.

      • MessageFragment

        public MessageFragment(@NotNull
                       @NotNull MessageFragment source)
        This constructor will copy an existing message fragment

      • MessageFragment

        public MessageFragment(@PropertyKey(resourceBundle="locale.display") @NotNull
                       @NotNull java.lang.String displayKey)
        This constructor will create a message fragment with defined message display key. You can add arguments with the "with" method.
        Parameters:
        displayKey - the message display key

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public MessageFragment with(@NotNull
                            @NotNull java.lang.String propName,
                            java.lang.Object propValue,
                            @NotNull
                            Property.SpecialHandling specialHandling)
        This method will add a property for this message. There can be multiple properties. If this object uses a display key, the property values will be passed as arguments to the DisplayKey to create the message string in the order they are defined. Also, properties will be serialized with the error information in subclass (see ErrorDetail and ErrorInfo This method also permits setting special handling (see Property.SpecialHandling) for the added property.
        Parameters:
        propName - the name of the property
        propValue - the value of the property
        specialHandling - any special handling desired for the property
        Returns:
        this

        This method will add a property for this message. There can be multiple properties. If this object uses a display key, the property values will be passed as arguments to the DisplayKey to create the message string in the order they are defined. Also, properties will be serialized with the error information in subclass (see ErrorDetail and ErrorInfo
        Parameters:
        propName - the name of the property
        propValue - the value of the property
        Returns:
        this

      • getMessage

        public final java.lang.String getMessage()

      • getProperties

        public final java.util.List<Property> getProperties()
        This method will return the properties, note that this is list has only been filtered by the hide special handling. The other special handling properties must be done by the caller.
        Returns:
        the list of properties.

      • getPropertyValue

        public final java.lang.Object getPropertyValue(@NotNull
                                               @NotNull java.lang.String propName)
        This method will return the value for a specific property. Note this will return the first match property but the list can have duplicate property names.
        Parameters:
        propName - the property to fetch
        Returns:
        the value
